title: High Carbon Sequestration from Forest Land
description: In 2022, Uganda's forest land absorbed a net total of 43.07 Mt CO2e, showcasing its significant role in carbon sequestration.

title: Low Coverage of Social Protection Programs
description: As of 2016, only 1.52% of Uganda's population was covered by social protection and labor programs, indicating a need for expansion.

title: Minimal Social Safety Net Coverage
description: In 2016, just 0.66% of Uganda's population benefited from social safety net programs, highlighting a gap in social welfare.

title: Limited Social Insurance for the Poorest
description: Only 0.03% of the poorest quintile in Uganda had access to social insurance programs in 2016, reflecting a significant disparity.

title: Effective Malaria Treatment for Children
description: In 2019, 62.5% of children under age 5 with fever in Uganda received antimalarial drugs, demonstrating effective healthcare intervention.

title: Low Prevalence of Female Genital Mutilation
description: By 2016, the prevalence of female genital mutilation in Uganda was at a low 0.3%, indicating progress in women's rights.
